description: This protocol provides a method for analysis of the relative abundance of potential antibiotic resistance genes found in the virome. We use the Comprehensive Antibiotic Resistance Database (CARD) as our reference for potential antibiotic resistance genes.
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

collections.protocol_name: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome
collections.protocol_name_html: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome

authors: HANNIGAN GD, GRICE EA, ET AL.

authors_list.name: HANNIGAN GD
authors_list.affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

authors_list.name: GRICE EA
authors_list.affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

authors_list.name: ET AL.
authors_list.affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

guidelines:
Required Software:
  • CARD
  • VFDB
  • NCBI's BLAST+ v2.2.0
  • Bowtie2-2.1.0
Relevant Files
Output:
  • CARD_abx_resistance/CARD_annotated_orfs_in_otu_table.tsv
  • CARD_abx_resistance/orf_otu_table.tsv
Perl Script: calculate_abundance_from_sam.pl
R Script: R14

components.data: Download antibiotic resistance ontology reference info to use with the database.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Download antibiotic resistance ontology reference info to use with the database.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Script P12: Antibiotic Resistance
source_data.annotation: Working directory for this reference modification is './references/CARD/'
source_data.thread_text: Working directory for this reference modification is './references/CARD/'
source_data.body: Working directory for this reference modification is './references/CARD/'

components.data: Download the antibiotic resistance protein and gene database.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Download the antibiotic resistance protein and gene database.

components.data: Unzip the zipped files that were downloaded.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Unzip the zipped files that were downloaded.

components.data: Build blast databases from the antibiotic resistance databases. Make the protein reference databases.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Build blast databases from the antibiotic resistance databases. Make the protein reference databases.

components.data: We also need a usable reference table so that we can annotate the antibiotic resistance gene hits with antibiotic resistance gene category names, which will especially aid the visualization of the relative abundance profiles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We also need a usable reference table so that we can annotate the antibiotic resistance gene hits with antibiotic resistance gene category names, which will especially aid the visualization of the relative abundance profiles.

source_data.name: cat ./aro.obo | tr "\n" "@" | sed 's/@@/\n/g' | grep -v format-version | grep -v Typedef | sed 's/\[Term\]@id\:\s//g' | sed 's/@.*@is_a/\tis_a/' | grep is_a | sed 's/@relationship.*//' | sed 's/is_a.*\!\s//' | sed 's/ /_/g' > ./ARO_numbers_and_AR_groups.tsv

components.data: Get a list of ARO numbers with their corresponding gene ID numbers and taxonomic associations from fasta. The fasta is annotated as a heirarchy so all ARO numbers should be taken.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get a list of ARO numbers with their corresponding gene ID numbers and taxonomic associations from fasta. The fasta is annotated as a heirarchy so all ARO numbers should be taken.

source_data.name: grep '>' AR-polypeptides.fa | sed 's/>//' | sed 's/ARO:1000001//g' |sed 's/\s.*ARO/\tARO/' | sed 's/\ .*\[/\t[/' | sed 's/ /_/g' > ./gene_IDs_and_ARO_numbers_and_AR_groups.tsv

components.data: Next, merge the files (using awk) into a single reference database
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Next, merge the files (using awk) into a single reference database

source_data.name: awk 'FNR==NR { a[$1]=$2; next } $2 in a { print a[$2]"\t"$1"\t"$2"\t"$3 }' ./ARO_numbers_and_AR_groups.tsv ./gene_IDs_and_ARO_numbers_and_AR_groups.tsv > ./CARD_annotation_reference.tsv

components.data: From here we can annotate the virome open reading frames with the CARD reference database. We also want to get the CARD reference gene length so that we can calculate the RPKM values below. Once we have this information, we will use Bowtie to map each sample's individual, non-assembled reads to the annotated ORFs. This information can be used to generate a relative abundance table (like an OTU table), like the relative abundance table we described in our taxonomic analysis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: From here we can annotate the virome open reading frames with the CARD reference database. We also want to get the CARD reference gene length so that we can calculate the RPKM values below. Once we have this information, we will use Bowtie to map each sample's individual, non-assembled reads to the annotated ORFs. This information can be used to generate a relative abundance table (like an OTU table), like the relative abundance table we described in our taxonomic analysis.

components.data: We want to calculate the relative abundances as RPKM, since there can be a skew in the lengths of certain antibiotic resistance gene lengths.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We want to calculate the relative abundances as RPKM, since there can be a skew in the lengths of certain antibiotic resistance gene lengths.

source_data.name:
# Now back to the usual top level working directory

#Make directory for the results
mkdir ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs

components.data: Perform blastx of the predicted ORFs against the CARD database reference. Use gene fasta file (from glimmer3) from the predict_orfs_using_glimmer.sh script.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform blastx of the predicted ORFs against the CARD database reference. Use gene fasta file (from glimmer3) from the predict_orfs_using_glimmer.sh script.

components.data: Filter by percent identity this way since the functionality is not built into blastx.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter by percent identity this way since the functionality is not built into blastx.

components.data: Also calculate lengths of the orfs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Also calculate lengths of the orfs.

components.data: Get abundance of sequences that map to the variosu ORFs. Run bowtie2 of the negative cleaned samples against the contig reference database. First build bowtie reference of the ORFs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get abundance of sequences that map to the variosu ORFs. Run bowtie2 of the negative cleaned samples against the contig reference database. First build bowtie reference of the ORFs.

components.data: Map the sequences to the ORFs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Map the sequences to the ORFs.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits
run_bowtie2_against_orfs () {
if [ -f /etc/profile.d/modules.sh ]; then
   	source /etc/profile.d/modules.sh
fi
module load bowtie2-2.1.0
bowtie2 -x ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_clean_against_unanot_orfs/bowtie2_orf_build -f ./negative_clean_seqs/$1 -S ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits/$1 -L 25 -N 1
}
export -f run_bowtie2_against_orfs
ls ./negative_clean_seqs/ | xargs -I {} --max-procs=64 sh -c 'bsub -K -q max_mem64 "run_bowtie2_against_orfs {}"'

components.data: Rename the files to be .sam files.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rename the files to be .sam files.

source_data.name:
for file in $(ls ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits); do
	mv ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits/"${file}" ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits/"${file/%.fa/.sam}"
done

components.data: Calculate the ORF hit abundances form bowtie2 using Qi's estimation perl script.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate the ORF hit abundances form bowtie2 using Qi's estimation perl script.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 16 of Script P12: Antibiotic Resistance

source_data.name:
mkdir ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam
for file in $(ls ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits); do
	perl calculate_abundance_from_sam.pl ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/bowtie2_neg_cleaned_hits/${file} ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam/${file}
done

components.data: Rename the sam files to text files.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rename the sam files to text files.

source_data.name:
for file in $(ls ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam); do
	mv ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam/"${file}" ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam/"${file/%.sam/.txt}"
done

components.data: Add in ORF length information using awk.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add in ORF length information using awk.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_abundance_with_length
for file in $(ls ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam); do
	sed 's/__len\=/\t/' ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/abundance_from_sam/${file} | tail -n +2 > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_abundance_with_length/${file}
done

components.data: Generate rpkm information for hits to the ORFs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate rpkm information for hits to the ORFs.

components.data: Add an echo of the sum value to confirm that the sum is being calculated.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an echo of the sum value to confirm that the sum is being calculated.

components.data: Match the rpkm values to an ORF master list for generating a complete ORF OTU table. First generate a master list of the ORFs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Match the rpkm values to an ORF master list for generating a complete ORF OTU table. First generate a master list of the ORFs.

components.data: Add a header to the master list for later.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a header to the master list for later.

components.data: Align each individual relative abundance chart to the master ORF list.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Align each individual relative abundance chart to the master ORF list.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list
for file in $(ls ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm); do
	awk 'FNR==NR {a[$1]=$4;next}{ print $1"\t"a[$1] }' ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm/${file} ./glimmer3/master_orf_list.txt | sed '/[0-9]\t[0-9]/!s/$/0/' | sed "1 s/^/ORF_ID\t${file}\n/" > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list/${file}
done

components.data: Get lists of the rpkm information only so that they can be merged with the master file.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get lists of the rpkm information only so that they can be merged with the master file.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list_only_rpkm
for file in $(ls ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list); do
	cut -f 2 ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list/${file} > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list_only_rpkm/${file}
done
paste ./glimmer3/master_orf_list_with_header.txt ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_rpkm_smpls_to_master_orf_list_only_rpkm/* > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/orf_otu_table.tsv

components.data: Create a reference table with the ORFs (annotated with blastx in annotate_orfs_CARD_VFDB.sh) and their corresponding CARD hits.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Create a reference table with the ORFs (annotated with blastx in annotate_orfs_CARD_VFDB.sh) and their corresponding CARD hits.

source_data.name: awk 'FNR==NR { a[$2]=$1"\t"$4; next } $2 in a { print $1"\t"a[$2] }' /project/egricelab/references/CARD/CARD_annotation_reference.tsv ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/blastx_CARD_glimmer_total_orfs.txt | sed 's/__len=[^\t]\+\t/\t/' > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_annotated_orfs.tsv

components.data: Substitute the ORFs in the orf_otu_table.tsv with CARD annotations.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Substitute the ORFs in the orf_otu_table.tsv with CARD annotations.

source_data.name: awk 'FNR==NR { a[$1]=$0; next } $1 in a { print $2"\t"a[$1] }' ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/orf_otu_table.tsv ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_annotated_orfs.tsv | cut -f '1,3-' > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_annotated_orfs_in_otu_table_without_header.tsv

components.data: We can then determine how many CARD ORFs are found on phage contigs, the taxonomic IDs of those phages, and visualize those contigs. The visualization information (contig fastas and glimmer annotations as .gff3 files) can be used in the program Geneious.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We can then determine how many CARD ORFs are found on phage contigs, the taxonomic IDs of those phages, and visualize those contigs. The visualization information (contig fastas and glimmer annotations as .gff3 files) can be used in the program Geneious.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 28 of Script P12: Antibiotic Resistance
source_data.annotation: In this section we are going to determine how many ORFs are found on contigs that are annotated as bacteriophages. In other words, calculate the number of phage contigs that contain CARD ORFs
source_data.thread_text: In this section we are going to determine how many ORFs are found on contigs that are annotated as bacteriophages. In other words, calculate the number of phage contigs that contain CARD ORFs
source_data.body: In this section we are going to determine how many ORFs are found on contigs that are annotated as bacteriophages. In other words, calculate the number of phage contigs that contain CARD ORFs

source_data.name:
# Get a list of the contigs that contain CARD ORFs
cut -f 1 ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_annotated_orfs.tsv | sed 's/_\.orf.*$//' | sort | uniq | sed 's/^/\>/' | sed 's/$/_/' > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_ORFs_for_comparing_to_phages.tsv

components.data: Get a list of the contigs that contain phage ORFs that were generated in predict_temperate_phages.sh
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get a list of the contigs that contain phage ORFs that were generated in predict_temperate_phages.sh

source_data.name:
cp ./phage_lifecycle/integrase/phage_contigs_no_negs_uniq.txt ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/phage_contigs_no_negs_uniq.txt

awk 'FNR==NR { a[$1]=$1; next } $1 in a { print $1"\t"a[$1] }' ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/CARD_ORFs_for_comparing_to_phages.tsv ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/phage_contigs_no_negs_uniq.txt > ./CARD_taxonomy_using_orfs/phage_contigs_containing_CARD_ORFs.tsv

components.name: Description

source_data.description: To easily visualize the contigs, run custom perl scripts and visualize in geneous.

components.data: Finally convert the glimmer .predict format to gff3 so it can be used in geneous and other genome browsers (Geneious). Here you need to specify the contig ID number you want, so it might be best to run it through a loop. Here is an example of how it works for contig number 1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Finally convert the glimmer .predict format to gff3 so it can be used in geneous and other genome browsers (Geneious). Here you need to specify the contig ID number you want, so it might be best to run it through a loop. Here is an example of how it works for contig number 1.

components.data: To get all of the contigs with CARD genes and hits to phage genes (or are themselves phage genes), first get togehter a list of those contigs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To get all of the contigs with CARD genes and hits to phage genes (or are themselves phage genes), first get togehter a list of those contigs.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/
mkdir ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/gff3Files
mkdir ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/contigFastaFiles
cut -f 1 ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenes/list_CARD_and_phage_contigs.tsv | sed 's/>//' | sed 's/_//' > ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/ContigAccList.tsv
for i in $(cat ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/ContigAccList.tsv); do
	perl GlimmerPredict2Gff3.pl ./CARD_contig_visualization/overallContigAnnotation/ContigsFromGlimmerAnnotated.txt ${i} ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/gff3Files/${i}.gff3
	grep -A 1 \>${i}_ ./ray_contigs_from_total_cat_pairs/Contigs_no_block_with_names.fasta > ./CARD_contig_visualization/PhageCardGenesAnnotations/contigFastaFiles/${i}.fa
done

source_data.description: Assess what taxa the VFDB annotate ORFs are co-localizing with. Make directory for output.

components.data: Test whether these contigs are also contigs with phage genes present. Use the contig list from calculate_orf_VFDB_rel_abund.sh which has contigs with both phages and VFDB orfs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Test whether these contigs are also contigs with phage genes present. Use the contig list from calculate_orf_VFDB_rel_abund.sh which has contigs with both phages and VFDB orfs.

components.data: As mentioned earlier in analysis, there are 68 VFDB + phage contigs. Now get the predicted IDs for those contigs that contain phage and VFDB orfs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: As mentioned earlier in analysis, there are 68 VFDB + phage contigs. Now get the predicted IDs for those contigs that contain phage and VFDB orfs.

source_data.name: awk 'FNR==NR { a[$1]=$1"\t"$2"\t"$3"\t"$4"\t"$5"\t"$6; next } $1 in a { print $1"\t"a[$1] }' ./CARD_contig_visualization/contig_id_reference_table_format_for_CARD.tsv ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenes/phage_contigs_containing_VFDB_ORFs_single_col.tsv > ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenes/list_VFDB_contig_phageIDs.tsv

components.data: They are mostly within bacillus phages. Get counts of the IDs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: They are mostly within bacillus phages. Get counts of the IDs.

components.data: To easily visualize the contigs, run my perl scripts and visualize in geneous.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To easily visualize the contigs, run my perl scripts and visualize in geneous.

components.data: Then replace the uniprot accession numbers with human readable gene names.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Then replace the uniprot accession numbers with human readable gene names.

components.data: Finally convert the glimmer .predict format to gff3 so it can be used in geneous and other genome browsers. Here you need to specify the contig ID number that you want, so it might be best to run it through a loop. Here is an example of how it works with contig 1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Finally convert the glimmer .predict format to gff3 so it can be used in geneous and other genome browsers. Here you need to specify the contig ID number that you want, so it might be best to run it through a loop. Here is an example of how it works with contig 1.

components.data: To get all of the contigs with VFDB genes and hits to phage genes (or are themselves phage genes), first get together a list of those contigs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To get all of the contigs with VFDB genes and hits to phage genes (or are themselves phage genes), first get together a list of those contigs.

source_data.name:
mkdir ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/
mkdir ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/gff3Files
mkdir ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/contigFastaFiles
cut -f 1 ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenes/list_VFDB_contig_phageIDs.tsv | sed 's/>//' | sed 's/_//' > ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/ContigAccList.tsv
for i in $(cat ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/ContigAccList.tsv); do
	perl GlimmerPredict2Gff3.pl ./VFDB_contig_visualization/overallContigAnnotation/ContigsFromGlimmerAnnotated.txt ${i} ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/gff3Files/${i}.gff3
	grep -A 1 \>${i}_ ./ray_contigs_from_total_cat_pairs/Contigs_no_block_with_names.fasta > ./VFDB_contig_visualization/PhageVFDBGenesAnnotations/contigFastaFiles/${i}.fa
done
